text: [Music]
once upon a time there lived a young man
named Huey Erskine a handsome charming
man who was as popular amongst men as he
was amongst the women what a great man's
so kind and humble such a charismatic
personality he speaks with such
eloquence Huey was a man who had
accomplished everything but was quite
unlucky when it came to financial
matters his father left him nothing but
his cavalry sword and the history of the
Peninsular war in fifteen volumes which
did not bring him any monetary value
Huey did not have a job and the only
income he had was 200 pounds a year that
his aunt would pay him as allowance he
had tried everything he could he had
spent over six months at the stock
exchange where he didn't fit in well
after all what is a butterfly to do in a
war zone like the stock exchange he then
moved on to become a tea merchant for a
longer time but soon grew tired of the
varieties of tea that he had to trade he
then went into the business of baking he
tried baking pies and cakes but it would
all be either too sweet or too hard or
just undercooked and now he was nothing
but a charming intellectual with a
charismatic personality brimming in
eloquence and poise but no profession to
top it all Huey was in love a beautiful
woman named Laura Merton had taken his
heart vice
she was the daughter of a retired
colonel
her church knew what to do my love I
have been trying everything I can to
find a profession all I can do is talk
don't worry too much sweetie you just
have to be strong till the right thing
comes along you shouldn't give up yes I
know you're amazing you know the way you
keep motivating me the two loved each
other a lot and were a very good-looking
couple but they didn't even have a
shilling between the two of them one day
Huey went over to meet Colonel Martin to
talk to him about his daughter's hand in
marriage
Colonel Merton was quite fond of Huey
and really wanted to see him do well in
life and every time Hughie would bring
out the topic of engagement the colonel
would just say oh dear Huey come back to
me when you have found yourself a
profession in which you can sustain
yourself Huey would always be quite sad
whenever the colonel would tell him this
and Laura would be there to console him
one day as Huey was going to Rockmore
park where the mertens live he stopped
by his friend Allen Walker's art studio
Walker was a painter and quite a good
one he was a rough and rugged looking
red bearded man with freckled skin but
when it came to his art he was a master
with a brush in his hand hello old
friend
Huey my boy how lovely it is to see you
this looks magnificent thank you
I'm just doing some finishing touches to
it Allen was painting a beautiful
life-sized portrait of a beggar man
the beggar himself was standing on a
raised platform in a corner of the
studio with the most piteous expression
on his face with one hand he leant on a
rough stick while with the other he held
out his battered hat for alms and what
an amazing model an amazing model I
should think so you will never come
across such a beggar anywhere host said
but to you painters his face must be an
absolute fortune of course you don't
want a beggar to look happy now do you
how much does a model make for something
like this I showing an hour how much do
you get for this painting for this I get
2,000 pounds I think the models should
get a percentage of the earnings they
work as hard as you do it's only fair
don't you think a few moments later Alan
got up to speak to the frame maker don't
run away Huey I shall be back in a
moment the old man took advantage of
Walker's absence from the room and sat
down on a wooden chair behind him he
looked so sad and forlorn with his
wrinkled face and torn clothes that Huey
could not help pitying him and felt
through his pockets for any money all he
could find was a sovereign poor old man
you will need it more than I do but it
means no tea for a fortnight he walked
across the room and slipped the
sovereign into the beggars hands the
beggar looked at Huey and smiled with
delight
thank you James thank you Walker had
arrived and with a smile on his face
Huey took his leave and made his way to
meet Laura that night
Huey went by the Stanley
they where he saw Walker sitting there
and now they're made
did you finish up the painting finished
and frame my friend oh and by the way
you have set yourself on quite a
conquest who really the household the
old man beggar that I was painting to
quite an interest in you after you left
he asked a lot of questions and I had to
tell him all about you who you are where
you live what your prospects and what
your income is Oh Ellen I may just find
him waiting outside my drawer when I get
home but you're joking aren't you
I just wish there was something I could
do to help the poor man I may have some
old clothes that he could wear instead
of those rags nobody should be living so
miserably
what do you call rags I call art anyways
tell me how Laura is the old man was
quite interested in her oh you don't
mean to say that you spoke to him about
her did you oh of course I did he knows
all about the colonel and Laura and the
deal for the job Ellen you told that
beggar all about my private affairs
how could you my boy what you call an
old beggar is actually one of the
richest men in all of Europe you could
buy the entire city tomorrow and not
worry about having less money what do
you mean that old man that you saw today
was none other than Baron house Berg is
a great friend of mine lies all my
pictures and gave me a great Commission
to paint him as a baker and I must say
that he looked perfect in those rags
Baron house Berg oh my I even gave him
his oven
you gave him a solver my friend you will
never see that sovereign again his
business is other people's money you
really should have told me Ellen I would
not have made such a fool of myself
never once did it ever occur to me that
you would go around distributing
sovereigns in such a reckless manner and
I did not know if the Baron would want
me to disclose his identity to you at
that time Hughie was quite ashamed of
what had happened he must think of me as
such a fool oh it was quite the opposite
he was in high spirits after you left I
wondered why he took such a great
interest in you but now I know he will
invest your sovereign for such a kind
deed I'm so unlucky I'm just going to
get home and go to bed you mustn't
mention this to Eddie whatever it would
be very embarrassing nonsense it
reflects a high credit on your
philanthropic spirit and a good heart
have a cup of tea and sit with me
you can talk about Laurel all you want
however Hughie was very unhappy with the
situation and walked back home the next
morning as Hughie opened his door to
pick up the morning newspaper he found a
well-dressed groomed man walking up to
his door have I the honour of speaking
to mr. earn scheme
[Music]
I have come here on behalf of Baron
Haussmann oh I hope that you can offer
my sincerest apologies to the Baron the
Baron has commissioned me to give you
this letter
thank you Huey took the envelope and
went inside on the envelope was written
a wedding present to Huey Erskine from
an old beggar on the inside was a letter
with a job offer for Huey which read
dear Huey Erskine my friend Allen Walker
speaks very highly of you and he has
told me all about what a bright and
generous spirits you have with a
situation like yours to still give your
last sovereign to a beggar for his
betterment is an act of a noble man
as for your situation with Laura Merton
I would like to repay your kindness by
offering you a job something that a
charismatic people's person like
yourself would quite enjoy I wish you
the best of luck for your future all
sincerely Baron house burg Huey was
ecstatic he could not control his
happiness and began to jump with joy and
so he was married to Laura Merton
the colonel was proud of the job that he
got Allen Walker was his best man at the
wedding Baron Hausberg gave a speech at
the wedding ceremony which left all the
people laughing and the couple were
brimming with happiness and after all
kindness of heart and generosity will
never go unrewarded
[Music]
